intro: Fedia scabra, commonly known as the rough fedia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Fedia scabra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets. Its botanical features make it an important component of its ecosystem, supporting various insect and bird species.
